intro: Acroceras excavatum, commonly known as the hollow-stemmed tansy, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in herbal remedies.
